intro: Oldenlandia thesiifolia f. lilacina, commonly known as the lilac-flowered spiderwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to lilac. The leaves are typically opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
